ygData.subject: Re: PoA bard quests plus a rant
ygData.msgSnippet: ... You can still do Permafrost over the Vox s lair section, plenty of IGs to go around ... No I don t since CT, Unrest, Upper Guk and most of Permafrost
ygData.messageBody:
> From: "Naeeldar" <jackal@...>
> You have multiple dungeons. I don't care for a change of pace all I want is to
> be less crowded and they can change that with more zones. You guys have
> so many options of zone that it's not even funny but lets say for 46+ we have
> the 3 planes now and sol b and guk. But wait there are people 30+ in guk and
> sol b. So all we really have is 3 zones.

You can still do Permafrost over the Vox's lair section, plenty of IGs
to go around

> Now for 30ish people you have a variety of outdoor zones, for dungeons you
> have permafrost, CT, Unrest, MM, Sol A, Guk, Lower Guk, Sol B. See the
> problem?

No I don't since CT, Unrest, Upper Guk and most of Permafrost greens out
at the 30s.

> I play a mid level char a 50 char and a low level char and there are no
> problems with the low or mid levle chars. High level chars there is a problem
> though. It's not like were complaining we need a change of pace we want
> something new for the hell of it we don't but you are. Seriously what problems
> do you have at mid or low levels?

I'm on a far less crowded server then most (peak last Sat night was 1921
people) but the over crowding is felt down at the lower levels just as
much as at the higher ones. And because the crowding is so bad, all
those 45+ players with nothing to do are creating new characters just so
they can have something to do. So the problem has trickled down quite
nicely so it really has affected us all.

> Not many high levels are plagued with overcrowded. Hell I love the lower guk
> zone and I'd be happy if they just duplicated the zone a bunch of times.
> Seriously though how about you list me a couple of problems you low mid levels
> have.

On my server, Lower is always packed. But then again, isn't most of
Lower Guk green for you also; much like MM is? So it's not really about
xp, it's about loot.

> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
> On the area of zones. Yes, I can hunt on reaver hill. Mistmoore is
> too deadly for me as higher levels train things out of the castle too
> frequently to make the entry area safe. Unrest is packed, last three times I was
> there there were 50+ people in them. Sol A and Sol B are obviously beyond
> my groups ability at 21-24. Haven't tried Paw since they lowered the
> difficulty but there was no way before. Befallen is also fairly
> crowded and most everything there is too low to give me much xp anyhow. Tried
> hunting skeletons in rathe but there were too many groups there as well. Went
> to S Karana but there were 75+ people there mostly hunting aviaks.

Funny I found the early 20s very frustrating with my ranger and now
with my bard as well.

MM- you need a full group at the early 20s. Stay on the wall by the
lake.
Permafrost- get a group and work the entrance only.
Everfrost- You can try doing Icy Orcs but the site always camped and the
spawn rate is too slow to really make it worthwhile.
Upper Guk is nice for early 20s as long as you don't mind ruining your
Froglock faction.
Befallen- this dungeon will green out for your group in a couple of
levels but bottom floor is still good _if_ it's not camped all to hell
by farmers.

These are places you can try. Forget Unrest and Aviaks as those spawns
are just too flipping full already

> The group my bard plays with though has so little downtime that
> we waste a lot of time when we are fully capable of knocking
> something off, only there isn't anything available. That
> frustration has cost me more guildmates than I care to think about.

And the failure of the high level characters to understand the plight of
the mid level characters has caused more guilds to explode then I care
to mention. It can be heartbreaking to watch.

> Its really frustrating hearing about all the new quests on the plane
> of sky when quests are my favorite part of the game. Lame as many of them
> are they are still more fun than camping.

The quests are my favorite parts of the game too. If it were not for
them and a very small handful of wonderful people on my server, I'd have
left the game long ago.

--
Kitsune Daiskoshi, Ranger of 33 seasons
Chortles Pyka, Bard of 21 seasons
Melancholy Diverted, Quellious Server
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Gwyn Carnegie, Systems Analyst gcarnegi@...
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
